issue.description: Diagram C.2 has problems referring to the current module. The PDM modules appear to do this correctly.

comment.description: Deferred to DIS level, requires new module

issue.description: Need to identify the orientation of (a set of) (possibliy incompletely modeled) GDT callouts as lying in a (Viewing) plane in 3D, in the geometric context of the three D shape_representation of a part or assembly Provide for a Viewing plane as in AP214/202 and relate it to the reference_plane of the GDT where appropriate.

comment.description: Deferred to DIS level, requires new module

issue.description: Need to assign a Visibility flag (all views or just viewing plane) to any (set of) annotation Provide a mechanism to specifying what elements are intended to be visible in each view.

comment.description: Deferred to DIS level, requires new module

issue.description: Need to capability to specify any engineering standards (e.g. ASME Y14.41, ISO 1101) that are intended to control the interpretation of gdt entities, and Gdt or other annotations. NOTE If individual callouts are incompletely modeled, e.g. with an annotation node and a reference to a GDT entity, as is suggested by US1 and US2 then the standard is needed for a pre-processor to interprete the GDT semantic, and to know how to construct the complete callouts( datum symbols etc Create a separate module that enables specifying a representation as dimensioned or toleranced, and specification of the controlling standard(s). This module should be used also in the case where there is GDT but no presentation.

comment.description: Deferred to DIS level, requires new module

issue.description: The modules must enable any annotations to be associated to other related annotations. Examples include: 1 Datums and Feature control frames. 2. Datum target sets 3. Multi datum features (common datums) 4. PatternsIf this can be done using GDT entities as an underlying model that is the best way.
